Description: Map of the Middle East, with cities represented pictorially, and with scenes from the Israelites' journey from Egypt arranged at centre, including Moses and the Burning Bush, and the Pharaoh's army drowning in the Red Sea; illustration to Jaques Joosten's 'De Kleyne Wonderlijcke Werelt' (Amsterdam, 1649). c. 1500 Woodcut
Curator's comments: The woodcut is unbound, inserted by page 53. This is one plate from a set of eight woodcuts illustrating Jaques Joosten's 'De Kleyne Wonderlijcke Werelt' (Amsterdam, 1649). For the curatorial comment on the entire work see 1972,U.40.1
Acquisition notes: Transferred to the department from the British Library in 1889; originally part of Hans Sloane collection.
